{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3233165,"name":null,"username":"shush","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/aeb1de/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-09-19T05:34:21.809Z","cooked":"

Hello!
We have a Raspberry Pi 4 with the photonvision image. I read somewhere that removing power the pi while it is writing data to the SD card can corrupt the SD card, and therefore it is best to run the command sudo shutdown -h now before doing that.

Problem is, our pi is powered by the VRM, and it will simply be powered on or off whenever we power the robot on or off.
Will this corrupt our SD card? If yes, is there a way to solve this problem?

(And another question, just out of curiosity: how come this isn’t a problem with other devices that use SD cards, like the RoboRIO?)

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-09-19T05:36:28.337Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":139,"reads":223,"readers_count":222,"score":739.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":441165,"topic_slug":"safely-power-off-raspberry-pi-with-photonvision-image","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51472,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/safely-power-off-raspberry-pi-with-photonvision-image/441165/1","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3233167,"name":"","username":"SirFire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sirfire/{size}/222590_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-19T05:52:27.328Z","cooked":"

Some images may take this into account and make specific read-only settings to avoid data corruption. I know that WPILibPi does this, which is outlined on this page. I also think that the RoboRIO has a read-only setup, except while deploying code I assume.

I’m unsure about PhotonVision, but maybe who knows can comment here.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-09-19T05:52:27.328Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":207,"readers_count":206,"score":61.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":441165,"topic_slug":"safely-power-off-raspberry-pi-with-photonvision-image","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/vision-processing/wpilibpi/the-raspberry-pi-frc-console.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"The Raspberry PI — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Main Programmer Dude | 8551"},"post_url":"/t/safely-power-off-raspberry-pi-with-photonvision-image/441165/2","custom_user_title":"Main Programmer Dude | 8551","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3233172,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-19T06:12:34.521Z","cooked":"

You can make the disc read-only, but that will prevent you from setting things. As long as you’re not trying to update the firmware or something when you power it off, you’ll be fine just hard powering off.

I always recommend keeping a spare SD card with all your Photonvision stuff set up for a quick swap if anything goes wrong.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-09-19T06:12:34.521Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":193,"readers_count":192,"score":68.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":441165,"topic_slug":"safely-power-off-raspberry-pi-with-photonvision-image","display_username":"Anand Rajamani","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21715,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/safely-power-off-raspberry-pi-with-photonvision-image/441165/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3233177,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-19T07:18:24.832Z","cooked":"

Just setup all your settings, then use raspi-config to enable read-only mode.

It’s relatively simple to remount to rw if you need to temporarily.

UPS are pretty common, e.g.

RobotShop USA

SunFounder Raspberry Pi UPS Power Supply Module V2.0 w/ Battery

Description Raspberry Pi UPS Power Supply Module V2.0 by SunFounder Includes battery Offers a power supply module for Raspberry Pi UPS Features four power indicators and a power switch Output: 5 V / 3 A Compatible with Raspberry Pi 4B/3B+/3B/Zero 2...

Price: USD 19.99

I don’t think PhotonVision do this, because you can change settings that are remembered between power cycles.

I would love to use a UPS, but they are most not legal. Sometimes they get missed in inspection, but sadly, they are not allowed by the current (2023) rules unless you can find one that has an “integral” battery or is powered by a USB battery pack.

PSA for PhotonVision Teams (Settings Loss Bug) PhotonVision
We tried the UPS out tonight and it worked great! It kept the pi running smoothly for over an hour, even between several battery swaps. There were no low-voltage throttling events reported on the PV settings page. I’m not expecting it to be an issue. The battery is 4000 mAH at 3.7v, so that’s 14.8 Wh. It’s also an integral part of a COTS computing device. We had an older version of this UPS on our robot in 2018. @Jon_Stratis Could you comment on any rule issues with this UPS device?
","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-09-19T19:15:55.304Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":137,"readers_count":136,"score":37.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":441165,"topic_slug":"safely-power-off-raspberry-pi-with-photonvision-image","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/psa-for-photonvision-teams-settings-loss-bug/428823/20","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"PSA for PhotonVision Teams (Settings Loss Bug)","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53190,"username":"truher","name":"joel truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/safely-power-off-raspberry-pi-with-photonvision-image/441165/8","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3233325,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-19T20:06:16.719Z","cooked":"
gdefender:

I would love to use a UPS, but they are most not legal. Sometimes they get missed in inspection, but sadly, they are not allowed by the current (2023) rules unless you can find one that has an “integral” battery or is powered by a USB battery pack.

PSA for PhotonVision Teams (Settings Loss Bug) - #20 by gdefender

Has there been any official judgment about that, e.g. by a regional inspector? I can’t find anything in the qa site.

In any case there are many versions of this idea, with varying levels of “integralness”

https://www.amazon.com/PiJuice-HAT-Portable-Platform-Raspberry/dp/B0788B9YGW

https://juice4halt.com/

The Pi Hut

LiPo Battery HAT for Raspberry Pi

The LiPo Battery HAT for the Raspberry Pi integrates an SW6106 power bank management chip, providing a 5V regulated power supply to your Raspberry Pi from a high capacity 3000mAh LiPo battery (included). The HAT will also charge the battery and...

Price: GBP 20.50

etc.

truher:

Has there been any official judgment about that, e.g. by a regional inspector? I can’t find anything in the qa site.

Yes, Jon Stratis is our LRI. Also, he said he ran it by Al and Chuck at HQ.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-09-19T20:25:42.480Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":21.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":441165,"topic_slug":"safely-power-off-raspberry-pi-with-photonvision-image","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/safely-power-off-raspberry-pi-with-photonvision-image/441165/10","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3233387,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-19T23:03:45.253Z","cooked":"

We ran a 10000mAh (or mWh, I can’t remember) power bank for our Orange Pi this year and it was given the OK by inspectors.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-09-19T23:03:45.253Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":98,"readers_count":97,"score":29.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":441165,"topic_slug":"safely-power-off-raspberry-pi-with-photonvision-image","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":44380,"username":"gdefender","name":"Andy Gasser","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/safely-power-off-raspberry-pi-with-photonvision-image/441165/11","custom_user_title":"6032 | QDash","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3233432,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-20T02:11:26.313Z","cooked":"

The rule we’re talking about is R602:

image788×248 69.6 KB

truher:

In any case there are many versions of this idea, with varying levels of “integralness”

https://www.amazon.com/PiJuice-HAT-Portable-Platform-Raspberry/dp/B0788B9YGW

https://juice4halt.com/

The PiJuice HAT would likely not be legal. It has a removable (non-integral) battery that is not a USB power bank.

The juice4halt might be legal, but it’s not powerful enough for a Pi 4. The Pi 4 needs at least 2.5A, but ideally 3.0A, and the juice4halt is only 1A!

crueter:

We ran a 10000mAh (or mWh, I can’t remember) power bank for our Orange Pi this year and it was given the OK by inspectors.

Yes, a USB battery pack is legal, up to 100Wh, and 5V, 2.5 Amp. Which also is likely not powerful enough for a Pi 4, ours reports undervoltage when connected to a power bank. It would probably be workable, but the Pi won’t operate at full capacity.

We ran our Pi 4 with a 12 volt Milwaukee Tool battery and a USB adaptor. Took about 30 extra minutes and a bunch of calls during inspection, but they let us keep it. We found a better way to power it for later competitions luckily.

What we’ve done in the past is wire up a hardware button that gracefully shuts down the board. It doesn’t always get used, we’ve found that the pis remain stable most of the time, but it’s an option for peace of mind. I’m not sure if we did it this year because we aren’t using a Pi to run our LED strips, so it wasn’t worth the time / work of setting up a breadboard hat.
